definitions.definition: An archeological or paleontological investigation, or the site where such an investigation is taking place.

definitions.example: He guffawed and gave me a dig in the ribs after telling his latest joke.

definitions.definition: A defensive pass of the ball that has been attacked by the opposing team.
A rare or interesting vinyl record bought second-hand.

To move hard-packed earth out of the way, especially downward to make a hole with a shovel. Or to drill, or the like, through rocks, roads, or the like. More generally, to make any similar hole by moving material out of the way.
definitions.example: If the plane can't pull out of the dive it is in, it'll dig a hole in the ground.

definitions.definition: To get by digging; to take from the ground; often with up.
To take ore from its bed, in distinction from making excavations in search of ore.
To work like a digger; to study ploddingly and laboriously.
To investigate, to research, often followed by out or up.

definitions.example: He dug an elbow into my ribs and guffawed at his own joke.

definitions.definition: To defend against an attack hit by the opposing team by successfully passing the ball
To understand or show interest in.
